message.text: Memory Allocation with Excessive Size Value.

properties.author: IARPA STONESOUP Test and Evaluation team
properties.description:
This test takes a number from the user, and attempts to allocate, initialize, and print out an array of that size. If the number is too large, memory allocation will fail and the program will subsequently crash.
Metadata
 - Base program: Apache Lucene
 - Source Taint: ENVIRONMENT_VARIABLE
 - Data Type: SIMPLE
 - Data Flow: VAR_ARG_LIST
 - Control Flow: RECURSIVE

taxa.name: Memory Allocation with Excessive Size Value

properties.author: IARPA STONESOUP Test and Evaluation team
properties.description:
This test takes in a value from a taint source.
 Math is performed on the value such that, if the
 value is 32767 or 32766, the resultant value 'wraps around',
 and becomes negative. This results in an infinite loop.
Metadata
 - Base program: Elastic Search
 - Source Taint: ENVIRONMENT_VARIABLE
 - Data Type: VOID_POINTER
 - Data Flow: JAVA_GENERICS
 - Control Flow: INTERPROCEDURAL_1

properties.author: IARPA STONESOUP Test and Evaluation team
properties.description:
This test takes in a value from a taint source.
 Math is performed on the value such that, if the
 value is 32767 or 32766, the resultant value 'wraps around',
 and becomes negative. This results in an infinite loop.
Metadata
 - Base program: Apache Lenya
 - Source Taint: SOCKET
 - Data Type: SIMPLE
 - Data Flow: ADDRESS_AS_FUNCTION_RETURN_VALUE
 - Control Flow: INFINITE_LOOP

properties.author: IARPA STONESOUP Test and Evaluation team
properties.description:
This test takes in a value passed as an argument
 This value is originally signed, but is converted
 to unsigned when stored in a char. This value is then
 used to index an allocated array with a signed value.
Metadata
 - Base program: Elastic Search
 - Source Taint: SOCKET
 - Data Type: SIMPLE
 - Data Flow: ADDRESS_AS_FUNCTION_RETURN_VALUE
 - Control Flow: FUNCTION_INVOCATION_OVERLOAD

properties.author: IARPA STONESOUP Test and Evaluation team
properties.description:
This test takes in a value from a taint source,
 which is then used to allocate an array. This value is
 positive when stored in a byte, but if the value is between 128 and
 255, becomes negative if stored in a byte. When this negative value
 is stored in a larger container (an int) it becomes a very large
 number. When this number is used as part of a loop, it results in an
 out of bounds exception.
Metadata
 - Base program: Apache Jena
 - Source Taint: ENVIRONMENT_VARIABLE
 - Data Type: SIMPLE
 - Data Flow: INDEX_ALIAS_1
 - Control Flow: INTERCLASS_1

properties.author: IARPA STONESOUP Test and Evaluation team

 255, becomes negative if stored in a byte. When this negative value
 is stored in a larger container (an int) it becomes a very large
 number. When this number is used as part of a loop, it results in an
 out of bounds exception.
Metadata
 - Base program: Apache Lucene
 - Source Taint: ENVIRONMENT_VARIABLE
 - Data Type: SIMPLE
 - Data Flow: ADDRESS_AS_FUNCTION_RETURN_VALUE
 - Control Flow: INDIRECTLY_RECURSIVE

properties.author: IARPA STONESOUP Test and Evaluation team
properties.description:
This test takes in a value passed in as an
 argument and uses it to compute a divisor which is
 later used in a modulus operation.
Metadata
 - Base program: Elastic Search
 - Source Taint: FILE_CONTENTS
 - Data Type: SIMPLE
 - Data Flow: ADDRESS_AS_FUNCTION_RETURN_VALUE
 - Control Flow: INTERCLASS_2

properties.author: IARPA STONESOUP Test and Evaluation team
properties.description:
This test takes in a value from a taint source,
 and creates a string array based on the value.
 Math is performed on the value such that, if the value is
 greater than 500, the resultant value 'wraps around', and becomes
 negative. This results in an exception being thrown, due to the
 invalid array size.

 - Base program: Elastic Search
 - Source Taint: SOCKET

 - Control Flow: FUNCTION_INVOCATION_OVERLOAD

properties.description:
This test takes in a value from a taint source,
 and creates a string array based on the value. Math is performed
 on the value such that, if the value is 32749 or greater, the
 resultant value underflows and becomes positive. This results
 in an infinite loop.
Metadata
 - Base program: Apache POI
 - Source Taint: SOCKET
 - Data Type: VOID_POINTER
 - Data Flow: ADDRESS_AS_FUNCTION_RETURN_VALUE
 - Control Flow: INTERCLASS_1

properties.author: IARPA STONESOUP Test and Evaluation team
properties.description:
This test takes in a char value from a taint source. The value is cast to a byte causing an unsigned to signed conversion. This value is then used to allocate an array. If the original char is >127 this will lead to a negative index for the array causing a NegativeArraySizeException.
Metadata
 - Base program: Apache Lucene
 - Source Taint: SOCKET
 - Data Type: VOID_POINTER
 - Data Flow: INDEX_ALIAS_1
 - Control Flow: SEQUENCE

message.text: Numeric Range Comparison Without Minimum Check.

properties.author: IARPA STONESOUP Test and Evaluation team
properties.description:
This test takes in a value from an argument and uses it as a array accessor resulting in an ArrayIndexOutOfBounds exception.

Metadata
-Base program: Apache Lucene
- Source Taint: ENVIRONMENT_VARIABLE
- Data Type: void_pointer
- Data Flow: basic
- Control Flow: recursive

taxa.name: Numeric Range Comparison Without Minimum Check

properties.author: IARPA STONESOUP Test and Evaluation team
properties.description:
This test takes a string, gets the first character, and uses a recursive method to look for the index of the second occurrence of that character. If the character does not appear a second time, it will recurse indefinitely.
Metadata
 - Base program: Apache JMeter
 - Source Taint: ENVIRONMENT_VARIABLE
 - Data Type: SIMPLE
 - Data Flow: BASIC
 - Control Flow: SEQUENCE

properties.author: IARPA STONESOUP Test and Evaluation team
properties.description:
This test takes in an integer n. The integer represents the number of buffers to allocate. For a large n an OutOfMemoryError will be generated. This error is caught and the program will continually try to request memory
Metadata
 - Base program: Apache POI
 - Source Taint: SOCKET
 - Data Type: VOID_POINTER
 - Data Flow: JAVA_GENERICS
 - Control Flow: BREAK_WITH_LABEL

 RuntimeException.

message.text: Loop with Unreachable Exit Condition ('Infinite Loop').

properties.author: IARPA STONESOUP Test and Evaluation team
properties.description:
This test takes a string, and reads through the string, printing out each character with ASCII value greater than 48. If it encounters a character with ASCII value less than 48, it will fail to increment the loop counter, and loop forever.
Metadata
 - Base program: Apache Lucene
 - Source Taint: FILE_CONTENTS
 - Data Type: ARRAY
 - Data Flow: VAR_ARG_LIST
 - Control Flow: INDIRECTLY_RECURSIVE

message.text: Allocation of File Descriptors or Handles Without Limits or Throttling.

properties.author: IARPA STONESOUP Test and Evaluation team
properties.description:
This test takes in integer n. The program attempts to open n files. If n is large enough the number of file handles will be exhausted, these files handlers are never closed, and stored in a global arraylist, causing the entire program to fail to open any files from that point on.
Metadata
 - Base program: JTree
 - Source Taint: SOCKET
 - Data Type: SIMPLE
 - Data Flow: BASIC
 - Control Flow: SEQUENCE

properties.author: IARPA STONESOUP Test and Evaluation team
properties.description:
This test takes a number as input and calculates it's factorial in 20 concurrent threads, without setting a limit on how large that number can be (as long as it's within Integer.MAX_VALUE). This can cause significant resource use when the input is large.

 which is then used to allocate an array. This value is
 positive when stored in a byte, but if the value is between 128 and
 255, becomes negative if stored in a byte. When this negative value
 is stored in a larger container (an int) it becomes a very large
 number. When this number is used as part of a loop, it results in an
 out of bounds exception.
Metadata
 - Base program: Coffee MUD
 - Source Taint: ENVIRONMENT_VARIABLE
 - Data Type: SIMPLE
 - Data Flow: ADDRESS_AS_CONSTANT
 - Control Flow: FUNCTION_INVOCATION_OVERLOAD

message.text: Numeric Range Comparison Without Minimum Check.

properties.author: IARPA STONESOUP Test and Evaluation team
properties.description:
This test takes in a value from an argument and uses it as a array accessor resulting in an ArrayIndexOutOfBounds exception.

Metadata
-Base program: Elastic Search
- Source Taint: SOCKET
- Data Type: simple
- Data Flow: address_as_function_return_value
- Control Flow: indirectly_recursive

taxa.name: Numeric Range Comparison Without Minimum Check

properties.author: IARPA STONESOUP Test and Evaluation team
properties.description:
This test takes in a value passed as an argument
 This value is originally signed, but is converted
 to unsigned when stored in a char. This value is then
 used to index an allocated array with a signed value.
Metadata
 - Base program: Coffee MUD
 - Source Taint: FILE_CONTENTS
 - Data Type: VOID_POINTER

properties.author: IARPA STONESOUP Test and Evaluation team
properties.description:
This test takes in a value from a taint source,
 and creates a string array based on the value.
 Math is performed on the value such that, if the value is
 greater than 500, the resultant value 'wraps around', and becomes
 negative. This results in an exception being thrown, due to the
 invalid array size.
Metadata
 - Base program: Coffee MUD
 - Source Taint: ENVIRONMENT_VARIABLE
 - Data Type: ARRAY
 - Data Flow: JAVA_GENERICS
 - Control Flow: RECURSIVE

properties.author: IARPA STONESOUP Test and Evaluation team
properties.description:
This test takes a number as input and calculates it's factorial in 20 concurrent threads, without setting a limit on how large that number can be (as long as it's within Integer.MAX_VALUE). This can cause significant resource use when the input is large.
Metadata
 - Base program: Apache Lucene
 - Source Taint: ENVIRONMENT_VARIABLE
 - Data Type: ARRAY
 - Data Flow: JAVA_GENERICS
 - Control Flow: INTERPROCEDURAL_50

 - Source Taint: SOCKET

properties.author: IARPA STONESOUP Test and Evaluation team
properties.description:
This test takes in a char value from a taint source. The value is cast to a byte causing an unsigned to signed conversion. This value is then used to allocate an array. If the original char is >127 this will lead to a negative index for the array causing a NegativeArraySizeException.
Metadata
 - Base program: Elastic Search
 - Source Taint: ENVIRONMENT_VARIABLE
 - Data Type: ARRAY
 - Data Flow: BASIC
 - Control Flow: INTERRUPT

properties.author: IARPA STONESOUP Test and Evaluation team
properties.description:
This test takes in an integer n. It creates n temporary files, and fills them with data. It then attempts to clean up, deleting the last 50 of the temporary files, leaving any files created before those in the temp directory.
Metadata
 - Base program: Apache Lucene
 - Source Taint: ENVIRONMENT_VARIABLE
 - Data Type: VOID_POINTER
 - Data Flow: INDEX_ALIAS_1
 - Control Flow: FUNCTION_INVOCATION_OVERLOAD

message.text: Allocation of File Descriptors or Handles Without Limits or Throttling.

properties.author: IARPA STONESOUP Test and Evaluation team
properties.description:
This test takes in integer n. The program attempts to open n files. If n is large enough the number of file handles will be exhausted, these files handlers are never closed, and stored in a global arraylist, causing the entire program to fail to open any files from that point on.
Metadata
 - Base program: Apache JMeter
 - Source Taint: FILE_CONTENTS
 - Data Type: SIMPLE
 - Data Flow: BASIC
 - Control Flow: SEQUENCE

taxa.name: Allocation of File Descriptors or Handles Without Limits or Throttling

message.text: Allocation of File Descriptors or Handles Without Limits or Throttling.

properties.author: IARPA STONESOUP Test and Evaluation team
properties.description:
This test takes in integer n. The program attempts to open n files. If n is large enough the number of file handles will be exhausted, these files handlers are never closed, and stored in a global arraylist, causing the entire program to fail to open any files from that point on.
Metadata

 - Source Taint: FILE_CONTENTS
 - Data Type: SIMPLE
 - Data Flow: BASIC
 - Control Flow: INTERUPT_CONTINUE

properties.author: IARPA STONESOUP Test and Evaluation team
properties.description:
This test takes in an integer n. The integer represents the number of buffers to allocate. For a large n an OutOfMemoryError will be generated. This error is caught and the program will continually try to request memory

 - Source Taint: FILE_CONTENTS
 - Data Type: SIMPLE

properties.author: IARPA STONESOUP Test and Evaluation team
properties.description:
This test takes in a value from a taint source.
 The value is truncated to an integer, and then used to generate
 a random number within a range. If the converted integer value
 is negative, SecureRandom.nextInt(value) will throw a
 RuntimeException.
Metadata
 - Base program: Apache Lenya
 - Source Taint: SOCKET
 - Data Type: ARRAY
 - Data Flow: JAVA_GENERICS
 - Control Flow: INTERPROCEDURAL_50

properties.author: IARPA STONESOUP Test and Evaluation team
properties.description:
This test takes a number and attempts to determine whether it is prime by dividing it by each number less than it. For large enough prime integers, this calculation takes an excessive amount of time.
Metadata
 - Base program: Elastic Search
 - Source Taint: FILE_CONTENTS
 - Data Type: SIMPLE
 - Data Flow: JAVA_GENERICS
 - Control Flow: SEQUENCE
